intro: Voacanga borneensis, commonly known as the Bornean voacanga, is a tropical tree native to the rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its rough, bark-like trunk and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by elongated, woody fruits containing numerous seeds. Its seeds are often used in traditional medicine for their purported medicinal properties. The tree plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, supporting various forms of wildlife.
